title: Ticket #2080: New ClassAd tests failing on 32-bit Debian with gcc 4.5.2
description:
Debian develeoper Michael Hanke reports a failure in the ClassAds test suite when reading input from an ifstream. He can reproduce the failure reliably, but only on a 32-bit x86 Debian machine using gcc 4.5.2 with optimizations enabled (-O2). The test program (extra_tests) only fails when run as part of 'make check'. If run directly on the command line, it succeeds.

I have been unable to reproduce the failures on a 32-bit rhel5 machine. I don't have access to a Debian machine with gcc 4.5.2 installed.

Michael has provided a patch that fixes the test failures. The patch doesn't address the underlying problem, which is still not understood and may lie outside the ClassAds code.
remarks:
2011-Apr-21 15:13:42 by jfrey:
Pushed a fix equivalent to Michael Hanke's patch to V7_6-branch for 7.6.1.
check_ins: 2011-Apr-21 15:12   Check-in [21538]: Do better input stream checking in new ClassAds. #2080 This fixes a test suite failure in some Debian configurations. (By Jaime Frey )
creator: jfrey
